conversation.content: I don't want to talk [excited] about this anymore, can we just— can we change the subject?
Oh wow, um, of course, I didn't realize— you know, sometimes I get carried away with these topics and, well, completely miss when someone's uncomfortable.
It's not that, it's— I mean, my head's just, er, pounding and I can't... honestly, I can't focus on anything abstract right now.
Hey hey, no worries at all, [over confidently] I totally get it— actually, when I'm stressed, abstract conversations are like, you know, trying to read through frosted glass, just impossible.
Everything feels impossible right now. My chest is so tight.
That sounds really rough. Do you want to just sit quietly for a minute? Sometimes that's all we need, just someone there without the pressure to perform or explain.
I don't— umm, the thing is, sitting still makes it worse, like, everything speeds up and, er, crashes together in my head.
Movement helps then? We could walk, or I could just ramble about something totally mundane while you pace— whatever feels right, no judgment here.
Why are you being so nice? People usually just tell me to breathe or calm down.
Because telling someone to calm down is, [delighted] honestly, the most useless advice ever— I mean, it's like telling someone who's drowning to, uhh, just swim better, you know?
My hands won't [high-pitched] stop shaking— well, this is, uh, embarrassing, I barely know you and here I am, basically, falling apart.
Listen, vulnerability isn't embarrassing, it's human. Plus, sometimes strangers are easier— no history, no expectations, just two people being real for a minute.
I can't [very loudly] BREATHE properly! It's like someone's sitting on my chest!
Okay, that's a panic response, totally normal even though it feels terrifying. Your body thinks there's a tiger but there's not— just your nervous system misfiring.
There might as well be a tiger. Everything feels dangerous.

I hear you, and that feeling is, [very quickly] um, so valid even though, actually, objectively nothing's attacking you right now— er, your brain just can't tell the difference between real and perceived threats.
What if this never stops? What if I'm broken?
You're not broken, you're overwhelmed, and those are completely different things. This will pass, it always does, even when it feels eternal in the moment.
I just— hmm, I want to believe you but, you know, my body won't... it's just that everything feels wrong.
That's okay, your body doesn't need to believe me right now. Just keep talking, keep moving, keep existing— sometimes that's the bravest thing we can do.
